item.title: My Father Keeps Forwarding Me Misinformation. How Often Do I Correct Him?
item.description: I worry about him. He has fallen prey to scams in the past.

item.title: The Gold Digger Was an Archvillain. Now She’s an Aspiration.
item.description: What do men and women really want in our fraught new mating economy?

item.title: Should My Husband Praise My Looks More?
item.description: A ruling on how to give and take compliments in a marriage.

item.title: Arundhati Roy on How to Survive in a ‘Culture of Fear’
item.description: The acclaimed writer has a new memoir, and a warning.

item.title: Should I Report My Neighbor’s Animal Abuse?
item.description: I feel trapped: afraid of overstepping with unpredictable neighbors, afraid of doing nothing and regretting it.

item.title: My Secret for Finding Peace in Traffic
item.description: How a lifelong speedster learned to love the right lane.

item.title: I Can’t Get Enough of These Easy Cheeseburgers
item.description: This jalapeño-packed recipe yields restaurant-quality results from your home kitchen.

item.title: My Brother’s an Unpleasant Drunk. Can I Cut Him Off?
item.description: Life feels too short to keep walking on eggshells around him.

item.title: What We Know About JPMorgan’s Long Relationship With Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: Times reporters combed through thousands of pages of legal and financial records to understand how America’s leading lender enabled the notorious sexual predator.

item.title: The Old Climate-Activism Playbook No Longer Works. What Else Can?
item.description: Activists are hoping to recreate the magic of 1970’s Earth Day — at a moment when the movement’s future is cloudier than ever.

item.title: I’ve Prepped for Future Disasters. Do I Have to Help Those Who Didn’t?
item.description: We can’t be the emergency food bank for everyone, but could we really let others suffer?

item.title: Brené Brown Doesn’t Want to Be Your Self-Help Guru Anymore
item.description: The author and podcaster wants to apply her old ideas about vulnerability and empathy to the workplace.

item.title: How JPMorgan Enabled the Crimes of Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: A Times investigation found that America’s leading bank spent years supporting — and profiting from — the notorious sex offender, ignoring red flags, suspicious activity and concerned executives.
